title: Airbnb's React Native Adoption and Retreat
summary: Airbnb adopted React Native for mobile, then deprecated it — a case study in technology trade-offs.
content:
Case Study: Airbnb and React Native

In 2016, Airbnb began using React Native to build their mobile apps, attracted by code sharing between iOS and Android. By 2018, they announced they were sunsetting React Native.

The Promise

React Native promised write-once, run-everywhere mobile development. For smaller teams it delivered, but Airbnb's complex app requirements exposed performance bottlenecks and deep platform integration challenges.

The Reality

Bridging between JavaScript and native code introduced performance overhead. Keeping up with React Native releases required significant maintenance. Native engineers found the bridge abstraction frustrating.

Key Learnings

Technology decisions must account for team expertise, app complexity, and long-term maintenance. Code sharing is appealing but not free. Write detailed post-mortems when deprecating technology.
